summary: The Career and Technical Education Access Act aims to establish a federal grant program to support and expand career and technical education (CTE) programs. It allows states to establish, improve, or expand CTE programs through various models, emphasizing industry partnerships, workforce alignment, and student access. Key elements include grant funding for infrastructure, curriculum development, and workforce training; workforce needs assessments; and a CTE Pell Grant for secondary school students. The bill seeks to prepare students for high-demand careers through hands-on learning and industry-recognized credentials.
